segger.training.train¶

Module Contents¶

class segger.training.train.LitSegger(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: lightning.LightningModule

LitSegger is a PyTorch Lightning module for training and validating the Segger model.

model¶

The Segger model wrapped with PyTorch Geometric’s to_hetero for heterogeneous graph support.

Type:

Segger

validation_step_outputs[source]¶

A list to store outputs from the validation steps.

Type:

list

criterion[source]¶

The loss function used for training, specifically BCEWithLogitsLoss.

Type:

torch.nn.Module

new_args[source]¶
cmp_args[source]¶
validation_step_outputs = [][source]¶
criterion[source]¶
from_new(num_tx_tokens: int, init_emb: int, hidden_channels: int, out_channels: int, heads: int, aggr: str, metadata: Tuple | torch_geometric.typing.Metadata)[source]¶

Initializes the LitSegger module with new parameters.

Parameters:

  • num_tx_tokens (int) – Number of unique ‘tx’ tokens for embedding (this must be passed here).

  • init_emb (int) – Initial embedding size.

  • hidden_channels (int) – Number of hidden channels.

  • out_channels (int) – Number of output channels.

  • heads (int) – Number of attention heads.

  • aggr (str) – Aggregation method for heterogeneous graph conversion.

  • metadata (Union[Tuple, Metadata]) – Metadata for heterogeneous graph structure.

from_components(model: Segger)[source]¶

Initializes the LitSegger module with existing Segger components.

Parameters:

model (Segger) – The Segger model to be used.

forward(batch: segger.data.utils.SpatialTranscriptomicsDataset) → torch.Tensor[source]¶

Forward pass for the batch of data.

Parameters:

batch (SpatialTranscriptomicsDataset) – The batch of data, including node features and edge indices.

Returns:

The output of the model.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

training_step(batch: Any, batch_idx: int) → torch.Tensor[source]¶

Defines the training step.

Parameters:

  • batch (Any) – The batch of data.

  • batch_idx (int) – The index of the batch.

Returns:

The loss value for the current training step.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

Defines the validation step.

Parameters:

  • batch_idx (int) – The index of the batch.

Returns:

The loss value for the current validation step.
